summary: An Ordinance providing for the improvement of Boren Avenue North, from John Street to Denny Way; and Denny Way, from Boren Avenue North to Westlake Avenue, all in the City of Seattle, by constructing therein a sewer of proper dimensions and material, together with all necessary catch basins, manholes and inlets and other appurtenances, in accordance with Resolution No. 159 of the City Council of the City of Seattle, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by act of the Legislature of the State of Washington, entitled "An act authorizing the issuance and sale of bonds by cities, to pay for local improvements, providing for the payment thereof, and declaring an emergency," approved March 14, 1899, and Ordinance No. 5693 of said city, approved December 6, 1899.
